text: The arrondissement of Sens is an arrondissement of France. It is part of the Yonne département in the Bourgogne-Franche-Comté region. Its capital is the city of Sens. ==History== When the Yonne was created on 17 February 1800, the arrondissement of Sens was part of that original department. ==Geography== The arrondissement of Sens is bordered to the northeast and east by the Aube (Champagne-Ardenne) department, to the south by the arrondissement of Auxerre, to the west by the Loiret (Centre-Val de Loire) department and to the northwest by the Seine-et-Marne (Île-de-France) department. It is the northernmost of the arrondissements of the department, with an area of , the smallest in area of the department. It has 114,298 inhabitants and its population density of inhabitants/km². ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of Sens, there are three cantons where not all their "communes" are in the arrondissement. The following table shows the distribution of the "communes" in the cantons and arrondissements: Cantons and communes in the arrondissement of Sens INSEE Code Canton Arrondissements Total Auxerre Avallon Sens 8906 Brienon-sur- Armançon 7 29 36 8908 Charny 36 2 38 8910 Gâtinais en Bourgogne 24 24 8911 Joigny 8 7 15 8914 Pont-sur-Yonne 10 10 8916 Sens-1 2 + part of Sens 2 + part of Sens 8917 Sens-2 5 + part of Sens 5 + part of Sens 8918 Thorigny-sur-Oreuse 17 17 8920 Villeneuve-sur-Yonne 12 12 ===Communes=== The arrondissement of Sens has 118 communes; they are (with their INSEE codes): #
